en.purpose: Used to stages cancer of the ovary, fallopian tube, and peritoneum.
en.use: Use postoperatively in patients with histologically-proven ovarian cancer (surgical pathology is needed in order to stage). Stages range from I-IV.

other_details.references: 1. Prat J, FIGO Committee on Gynecologic Oncology. Staging classification for cancer of the ovary, fallopian tube, and peritoneum. International Journal of Gynecology & Obstetrics. 2014 Jan;124(1):1-5.

when: $gt0012|Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries|==local::at0008|IA - Tumor limited to 1 ovary, capsule intact, no tumor on surface, negative washings|
$gt0012|Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries|==local::at0009|IB - Tumor involves both ovaries otherwise like IA|
$gt0012|Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries|==local::at0010|IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries|
$gt0013|IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries|==local::at0012|IC1 - Surgical spill|
$gt0012|Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries|==local::at0010|IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries|
$gt0013|IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries|==local::at0013|IC2 - Capsule rupture before surgery or tumor on ovarian surface|
$gt0012|Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries|==local::at0010|IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries|
$gt0013|IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries|==local::at0014|IC3 - Malignant cells in the ascites or peritoneal washings|

$gt0014|Stage II: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with pelvic extension (below the pelvic brim) or primary peritoneal cancer|==local::at0018|IIA - Extension and/or implant on uterus and/or fallopian tubes|
$gt0014|Stage II: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with pelvic extension (below the pelvic brim) or primary peritoneal cancer|==local::at0019|IIB - Extension to other pelvic intraperitoneal tissues|

$gt0015|Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes|==local::at0021|IIIA - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis|
$gt0016|IIIA Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis|==local::at0022|IIIA1 - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes only|
$gt0017|IIIA1 - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes only|==local::at0024|IIIA1(i) - Metastasis ≤10 mm|

$gt0015|Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes|==local::at0021|IIIA - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis|
$gt0016|IIIA Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis|==local::at0022|IIIA1 - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes only|
$gt0017|IIIA1 - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes only|==local::at0025|IIIA1(ii) - Metastasis >10 mm|

$gt0015|Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes|==local::at0021|IIIA - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis|

$gt0016|IIIA Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis|==local::at0026|IIIA2 - Microscopic, extrapelvic (above the brim) peritoneal involvement ± positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes|

$gt0015|Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes|==local::at0027|IIIB - Macroscopic, extrapelvic, peritoneal metastasis ≤2 cm ± positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes; includes extension to capsule of liver/spleen|

$gt0015|Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes|==local::at0028|IIIC - Macroscopic, extrapelvic, peritoneal metastasis >2 cm ± positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes; includes extension to capsule of liver/spleen|
$gt0018|Stage IV: Distant metastasis excluding peritoneal metastasis|==local::at0029|IVA - Pleural effusion with positive cytology|

$gt0018|Stage IV: Distant metastasis excluding peritoneal metastasis|==local::at0030|IVB - Hepatic and/or splenic parenchymal metastasis, metastasis to extra-abdominal organs (including inguinal lymph nodes and lymph nodes outside of the abdominal cavity)|

gt0001.description: Stages cancer of the ovary, fallopian tube, and peritoneum.

gt0005.text: Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis

gt0006.text: IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries

gt0007.text: Stage IV: Distant metastasis excluding peritoneal metastasis

gt0008.text: IIIA1 - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes only

gt0009.text: Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries

gt0010.text: Stage II: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with pelvic extension (below the pelvic brim) or primary peritoneal cancer

gt0011.text: Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes

gt0012.text: Stage I: Tumor confined to ovaries

gt0013.text: IC - Tumor limited to 1 or both ovaries

gt0014.text: Stage II: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with pelvic extension (below the pelvic brim) or primary peritoneal cancer

gt0015.text: Stage III: Tumor involves 1 or both ovaries with cytologically or histologically confirmed spread to the peritoneum outside the pelvis and/or metastasis to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes

gt0016.text: IIIA Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes and/or microscopic metastasis beyond the pelvis

gt0017.text: IIIA1 - Positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes only

gt0018.text: Stage IV: Distant metastasis excluding peritoneal metastasis
